osvSchema.details: The WP STAGING and WP STAGING Pro plugins for WordPress are vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in versions up to, and including, 3.4.3, and versions up to, and including, 5.4.3, respectively, via the ajaxSendReport function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract sensitive data from a log file, including system information and (in the Pro version) license keys. Successful exploitation requires an administrator to have used the 'Contact Us' functionality along with the "Enable this option to automatically submit the log files." option.

product_data.product_name: WP STAGING WordPress Backup Plugin – Migration Backup Restore
WP STAGING Pro WordPress Backup Plugin

description_data.value: The WP STAGING and WP STAGING Pro plugins for WordPress are vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in versions up to, and including, 3.4.3, and versions up to, and including, 5.4.3, respectively, via the ajaxSendReport function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract sensitive data from a log file, including system information and (in the Pro version) license keys. Successful exploitation requires an administrator to have used the 'Contact Us' functionality along with the "Enable this option to automatically submit the log files." option.

descriptions.value: The WP STAGING and WP STAGING Pro plugins for WordPress are vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in versions up to, and including, 3.4.3, and versions up to, and including, 5.4.3, respectively, via the ajaxSendReport function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract sensitive data from a log file, including system information and (in the Pro version) license keys. Successful exploitation requires an administrator to have used the 'Contact Us' functionality along with the "Enable this option to automatically submit the log files." option.

Los complementos WP STAGING y WP STAGING Pro para WordPress son vulnerables a la exposición de información confidencial en versiones hasta la 3.4.3 incluida, y versiones hasta la 5.4.3 incluida, respectivamente, a través de la función ajaxSendReport. Esto hace posible que atacantes no autenticados extraigan datos confidenciales de un archivo de registro, incluida información del sistema y (en la versión Pro) claves de licencia. La explotación exitosa requiere que un administrador haya utilizado la funcionalidad "Contáctenos" junto con la opción "Habilite esta opción para enviar automáticamente los archivos de registro".
